news.title: Chief Justice Considering Possibility of Ethics Code for Supreme Court, Kagan Reveals
news.description: While testifying before a House of Representatives appropriations subcommittee regarding the Supreme Court’s budget, Justice Elena Kagan disclosed that Chief Justice John Roberts is contemplating creating a separate code of judicial ethics that would apply only to the high court. Kagan’s statement came in response to discussion regarding accountability for judges in the #MeToo era.

news.title: Can Judges and Law Clerks Participate in Educational Seminars? Partisanship is a Factor, Opinion Says
news.description: The Judicial Conference of the United States has authorized its Committee on Codes of Conduct to publish an advisory opinion stating that federal judges and law clerks must consider the partisan affiliation and activities of any group sponsoring an educational seminar they plan to attend. The opinion comes on the heels of criticism by a number of Democratic senators regarding the conservative Heritage Foundation’s role in providing a training camp for judicial clerks.
